lead_paragraph: The former N.B.A. All-Star Eddie Johnson was arrested yesterday in Ocala, Fla., and charged with sexually assaulting an 8-year-old girl. The 51-year-old Johnson was also charged with residential burglary for entering the apartment where the girl and her brothers were staying while their mother was away, according to an Ocala Police Department report. During his 10-year N.B.A. career from 1977 to 1987, Johnson, known as Fast Eddie, played 675 games and averaged 15.1 points. Last month, he was charged with battery on a law enforcement officer and resisting or obstructing an officer without violence.
